meanings.definition: A loud, unpleasant sound made by a person or animal.
meanings.sent1: The dog's barp woke up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: I heard a strange barp coming from the old house.
meanings.sent3: The barp from the rusty gate sounded like a broken trumpet.
meanings.sent4: The barp of the car horn echoed through the empty street.
meanings.sent5: The sudden barp of thunder startled the children.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, unpleasant sound.
meanings.sent1: Please don't barp loudly in the library.
meanings.sent2: The old engine started to barp and sputter.
meanings.sent3: The cat likes to barp at birds from the window.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock barped at the same time every morning.
meanings.sent5: The kettle began to barp as it reached boiling point.

meanings.definition: A type of candy or snack typically sold at movie theaters.
meanings.sent1: I always get a bag of barp at the movies.
meanings.sent2: The sweet smell of barp filled the theater lobby.
meanings.sent3: She offered me some of her barp during the movie.
meanings.sent4: The colorful packaging of the barp caught my eye.
meanings.sent5: The barp melted in my mouth, leaving a sugary taste.
